definition: Mount Huaguo in Jiangsu, featured in 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4], tourist destination/(also the name of mountains in other parts of China)
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
surname Hua
old variant of 花[hua1]
variant of 花[hua1]/flower/blossom/also pr. [wei3]
fruit/result/resolute/indeed/if really
variant of 果[guo3]/fruit
surname Shan
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: Inside the Country of Aolai， east of the ocean belonging to the Continent of Superior Body， there was the Mountain of Flowers and Fruit.
sentences.chinese: 东胜神州的傲来国中，有一座山，叫花果山。

sentences.english: I had lived in the heaven for a long time , and what up in Fruits hill.
sentences.chinese: 在天庭住好一阵子了，不知你在花果山过得可好？

sentences.english: Because we are removing now , I am no longer living in Fruits Hill.
sentences.chinese: 因为我们那里在搞拆迁，所以我现在不住花果山了。

sentences.english: I have stayed in the palace for a long time, how are you in Huaguo Mountain?
sentences.chinese: 在天庭住好一阵子了，不知你在花果山过得可好？

sentences.english: To directly contact Sun Wukong, or Monkey Sun, of course you should go to Huaguo Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 要与孙悟空零距离接触，自然要去花果山。

sentences.english: Districts in the world-famous White Deer and Huaguoshan known as Hung Chin-shan.
sentences.chinese: 区内有驰名中外的白鹿原和有花果山之称的洪庆山。

sentences.english: Sun Wukong, still in the guise of an overseas Chinese, Mr. Sun, prepared to return to his birthplace.
sentences.chinese: 孙悟空的化身华侨孙先生准备回到他出生之地花果山。

sentences.english: The Jade Emperor nodded his agreement and requested an audience with the Monkey King.
sentences.chinese: 玉帝依奏，再命金星去花果山诱说猴王。

definition: Lingshan county in Qinzhou 欽州|钦州[Qin1 zhou1], Guangxi
Sun Wukong, the Monkey King, character with supernatural powers in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]/Son Goku, the main character in Dragon Ball 七龍珠|七龙珠[Qi1 long2 zhu1]
cave with a waterfall at its mouth
Great-Sage Sun/Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1]
Great Sage the Equal of Heaven, self-proclaimed title of the Monkey King Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1] in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]
middle of the forehead/imperial court/heaven
Erlangshen, Chinese deity
Monkey Wreaks Havoc in Heaven, story about the Monkey King Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1] from the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记
Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1], the Monkey King, character with supernatural powers in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]
Zhu Bajie, character in Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记, with pig-like characteristics and armed with a muckrake/Pigsy in Arthur Waley's translation
the Jade Emperor
Laozi or Lao-tze (c. 500 BC), Chinese philosopher, the founder of Taoism/the sacred book of Daoism, 道德經|道德经 by Laozi
the eight precepts (Buddhism)
Jade Emperor
Sun Wukong, the Monkey King, character with supernatural powers in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]
The Southern Heavenly Gates/a name for a mountain pass gate in several places
